info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MASON COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 526 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loyal Valley, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Art, Hedwigs Hill, Loyal Valley, Hilda, and Us-87 Near The Mason- Gillespie County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
